title: Burger King's Parent Names New Chairman
text:
Two of Restaurant Brands' biggest divisions, Tim Hortons and Burger King, have struggled coming out of the pandemic. Covid-19 restrictions in Canada hurt sales at coffee chain Tim Hortons. Burger King, traditionally the second-biggest burger brand behind McDonald's Corp., in 2020 slipped behind Wendy's Co.

Toronto-based Restaurant Brands recently increased investment in its chains, which include Popeyes Louisiana Kitchen and Firehouse Subs.

Mr. Doyle said he is confident his work will boost the company's stock, and was putting his own money behind it. "My investment in this is the best indication I can give you that there's a lot of value that can be created here," he said.

Restaurant Brands last year installed another longtime Domino's executive to head Burger King's U.S. business. The company recently said it would spend $400 million to boost Burger King's U.S. advertising and store conditions.

Mr. Doyle will earn the performance-linked shares if Restaurant Brands' stock climbs to at least $81.32 in five years, with a maximum award if the company's stock increases to more than $122, the company said. Restaurant Brands shares rose 6.7% Wednesday to $63.75.
